Newton Abbot Racecourse.label: Newton Abbot Racecourse
Newton Abbot Racecourse.description: Newton Abbot Racecourse is a thoroughbred horse racing venue located on the north bank of the River Teign in the parishes of Kingsteignton and Teigngrace just north of Newton Abbot, Devon, England. Wikipedia

Arlington Park.label: Arlington Park
Arlington Park.description: Arlington International Racecourse is a horse race track in the Chicago suburb of Arlington Heights, Illinois. Wikipedia

Haydock Park Racecourse.label: Haydock Park Racecourse
Haydock Park Racecourse.description: Haydock Park Racecourse is a racecourse in Merseyside, England. The racecourse is set in an area of parkland bounded by the towns of Haydock to the west, Ashton-in-Makerfield to the north, Golborne to the east and Newton-le-Willows to the south. Wikipedia

Sedgefield Racecourse.label: Sedgefield Racecourse
Sedgefield Racecourse.description: Sedgefield Racecourse is an English horse racing course located south of the city of Durham, close to the village of Sedgefield, owned by Northern Racing plc. It is a left-handed course, used for jump racing only. Wikipedia

Los Alamitos Race Course.label: Los Alamitos Race Course
Los Alamitos Race Course.description: Los Alamitos Race Course is a horse racing track in Cypress, California. The track hosts both thoroughbred and quarter horse racing. Wikipedia

Fort Erie Race Track.label: Fort Erie Race Track
Fort Erie Race Track.description: Fort Erie Race Track is a horse racing facility in Fort Erie, Ontario, Canada built by the Fort Erie Jockey Club and inaugurated on June 16, 1897. Wikipedia

Carlisle Racecourse.label: Carlisle Racecourse
Carlisle Racecourse.description: Carlisle Racecourse is a thoroughbred horse racing venue located at Blackwell village, near Carlisle, Cumbria, England. The course has been on its present site since 1904, when it moved there from another location near Carlisle. Wikipedia

Exeter Racecourse.label: Exeter Racecourse
Exeter Racecourse.description: Exeter Racecourse is a thoroughbred horse racing venue located near the city of Exeter, Devon, England. Locally it is known as Haldon racecourse because of its location on top of the Haldon Hills. Wikipedia

Kokura Racecourse.label: Kokura Racecourse
Kokura Racecourse.description: Kokura Racecourse is located in Kokura Minami-ku Kitakyushu, Japan. It is used for horse racing. It was built in 1994. It has a capacity of 20,000. It has 1,192 seats. Wikipedia
Address: 〒802-0841 福岡県北九州市小倉南区北方４丁目５−１

Newcastle Racecourse.label: Newcastle Racecourse
Newcastle Racecourse.description: Newcastle Racecourse is a horse racing course located at Gosforth Park near Newcastle upon Tyne, England, owned by Northern Racing. Wikipedia

Sapporo Racecourse.label: Sapporo Racecourse
Sapporo Racecourse.description:
Sapporo Racecourse is located in Chūō-ku, Sapporo, Hokkaido, Japan. It was built in 1907 for horse racing use. It has 12,000 seats, with a capacity of 30,000.
Sapporo Racecourse hosts one GII race, the Sapporo Kinen. Wikipedia

Keeneland.label: Keeneland
Keeneland.description: Keeneland includes the Keeneland Racecourse, a Thoroughbred horse racing facility, and a sales complex, both in Lexington, Kentucky, USA. Wikipedia

Woodbine Racetrack.label: Woodbine Racetrack
Woodbine Racetrack.description: Woodbine Racetrack is a Canadian race track for thoroughbred and standardbred racing at 555 Rexdale Blvd. in the city of Toronto, Ontario. Wikipedia

Brighton Beach Race Course.label: Brighton Beach Race Course
Brighton Beach Race Course.description: The Brighton Beach Race Course was an American Thoroughbred horse racing facility opened at Brighton Beach, Coney Island, New York on June 28, 1879 by the Brighton Beach Racing Association. Wikipedia

Newmarket Racecourse.label: Newmarket Racecourse
Newmarket Racecourse.description: Newmarket Racecourse, which has a capacity of 45,000, is a British Thoroughbred horse racing venue in the town of Newmarket, Suffolk. Wikipedia

Rosecroft Raceway.label: Rosecroft Raceway
Rosecroft Raceway.description: Rosecroft Raceway, nicknamed the "Raceway by the Beltway" for being close to Interstate 495, is a harness racing track in Fort Washington, Maryland. It first opened in 1949 and was owned by William E. Miller, a horse trainer and breeder. Wikipedia

Sheepshead Bay Race Track.label: Sheepshead Bay Race Track
Sheepshead Bay Race Track.description: Sheepshead Bay Race Track was an American Thoroughbred horse racing facility built on the site of the Coney Island Jockey Club at Sheepshead Bay, New York. Wikipedia

Southwell Racecourse.label: Southwell Racecourse
Southwell Racecourse.description: Southwell Racecourse is a thoroughbred horse racing venue located near Newark-on-Trent, Nottinghamshire, England. It is one of only four racecourses in the UK to have an all-weather track and is the only one with a fibresand surface. Wikipedia

Tattersalls Park.label: Tattersalls Park
Tattersalls Park.description: Tattersalls Park is a Thoroughbred horse-racing venue located on Goodwood Road within Glenorchy, Tasmania, Australia. Wikipedia

Pontefract Racecourse.label: Pontefract Racecourse
Pontefract Racecourse.description: Pontefract Racecourse is a thoroughbred horse racing venue located in Pontefract, West Yorkshire, England. Wikipedia

Newbury Racecourse.label: Newbury Racecourse
Newbury Racecourse.description: The Racecourse, Newbury is a racecourse in the civil parish of Greenham, adjoining the town of Newbury in Berkshire, England. It has courses for flat races and over jumps. It hosts one of Great Britain's 31 Group 1 flat races, the Lockinge Stakes. Wikipedia

Meadowlands Racetrack.label: Meadowlands Racetrack
Meadowlands Racetrack.description: The Meadowlands Racetrack is a horse racing track at the Meadowlands Sports Complex in East Rutherford, New Jersey, United States. The track hosts both thoroughbred racing and harness racing. It is known popularly in the region as "The Big M". Wikipedia

Beverley Racecourse.label: Beverley Racecourse
Beverley Racecourse.description:
Beverley Racecourse is a thoroughbred horse racing venue located in the town of Beverley in the East Riding of Yorkshire, England.
An annual meeting at Beverley was first established in 1767. Before that races had only occasionally been run there. Wikipedia

Folkestone Racecourse.label: Folkestone Racecourse
Folkestone Racecourse.description: Folkestone Racecourse was a thoroughbred horse racing venue in southeast England, until it closed in 2012. It is located in Westenhanger, by junction 11 of the M20 motorway and about two miles west of Folkestone. Wikipedia

Pimlico Race Course.label: Pimlico Race Course
Pimlico Race Course.description: Pimlico Race Course is a thoroughbred horse racetrack in Baltimore, Maryland, most famous for hosting the Preakness Stakes. Wikipedia

Redcar Racecourse.label: Redcar Racecourse
Redcar Racecourse.description:
Redcar Racecourse is a thoroughbred horse racing venue located in Redcar, North Yorkshire, England.
Its address is Redcar Racecourse Ltd, Thrush Road, Redcar TS10 2BY
Redcar is Yorkshire's seaside track, oval-shaped and perfectly flat. Wikipedia

Hipodromo do Cristal.label: Hipodromo do Cristal
Hipodromo do Cristal.description: Hipodromo do Cristal is the most important center of horse racing in the state of Rio Grande do Sul, Brazil. It is located at Porto Alegre. It was designed by renowned Uruguayan architect Roman Fresnedo Siri. Wikipedia

Seoul Race Park.label: Seoul Race Park
Seoul Race Park.description: Seoul Race Park is a 40,000 capacity Korean thoroughbred racetrack in Gwacheon, Gyeonggi-do, South Korea. It is host to many of Korea's most valuable thoroughbred horse races including the Korean Derby and Grand Prix. Wikipedia

Ayr Racecourse.label: Ayr Racecourse
Ayr Racecourse.description: Ayr Racecourse at Whitletts Road, Ayr, Scotland, was opened in 1907. There are courses for flat and for National Hunt racing. The course stages the highest-quality racing and most prestigious races run in Scotland in both codes of the sport. Wikipedia

Dufferin Park Racetrack.label: Dufferin Park Racetrack
Dufferin Park Racetrack.description: Dufferin Park Racetrack was a Canadian racetrack for thoroughbred horse races located on Dufferin Street in the city of Toronto, Ontario. Wikipedia

Gulfstream Park.label: Gulfstream Park
Gulfstream Park.description: Gulfstream Park Racing & Casino is a racetrack and county-approved racino in Hallandale Beach, Florida, in the United States. Wikipedia

Bath Racecourse.label: Bath Racecourse
Bath Racecourse.description: Bath Racecourse is a thoroughbred horse racing venue located on Lansdown Hill, just north of Bath, Somerset, owned by Arena Racing Company. Wikipedia

Chester Racecourse.label: Chester Racecourse
Chester Racecourse.description: Chester Racecourse, known as the Roodee, is according to official records the oldest racecourse still in use in England. Horse racing at Chester dates back to the early sixteenth century. Wikipedia

Taunton Racecourse.label: Taunton Racecourse
Taunton Racecourse.description: Taunton Racecourse is a thoroughbred horse racing venue located in Orchard Portman, two miles south of Taunton, Somerset, England. Wikipedia

Uttoxeter Racecourse.label: Uttoxeter Racecourse
Uttoxeter Racecourse.description: Uttoxeter Racecourse is a National Hunt racecourse in the town of Uttoxeter, in Staffordshire, England. Wikipedia

Wincanton Racecourse.label: Wincanton Racecourse
Wincanton Racecourse.description:
Wincanton Racecourse is a thoroughbred horse racing venue located in Wincanton, Somerset, England.
The steeplechase fences are large, making it a good test of a chaser. Wikipedia

Beulah Park Racetrack.label: Beulah Park Racetrack
Beulah Park Racetrack.description: Beulah Park is Ohio's first thoroughbred racetrack and premier event center, offering live thoroughbred racing from October through to early May. Wikipedia

Warwick Racecourse.label: Warwick Racecourse
Warwick Racecourse.description: Warwick Racecourse is a horse racing course in Warwick, England. It is a flat racing and steeple chasing course, and has a programme of 25 meetings throughout the year, many of which are televised. Wikipedia

Hazel Park Raceway.label: Hazel Park Raceway
Hazel Park Raceway.description: Hazel Park Raceway located in Hazel Park, Michigan is a harness race track offering live harness racing every Friday, Saturday and Monday night May through August and simulcast wagering 7 days a week ... Wikipedia

Niigata Racecourse.label: Niigata Racecourse
Niigata Racecourse.description: Niigata Racecourse is located in Kita-ku Niigata, Niigata. It is used for horse racing. It was built in 1965. The capacity of the stadium is 75,000. Wikipedia
Address: 〒950-3301 新潟県新潟市北区笹山3490

Fukushima Race Course.label: Fukushima Race Course
Fukushima Race Course.description: Fukushima Race Course is a horse racing course located in Fukushima, Fukushima. It was built in 1918. Wikipedia

Del Mar Racetrack.label: Del Mar racetrack
Del Mar Racetrack.description: Del Mar racetrack, which has a capacity of 44,000, is an American Thoroughbred horse racing track at the Del Mar Fairgrounds in the seaside city of Del Mar, California, 20 miles north of San Diego. Wikipedia

Raceway Park (Ohio).label: Hollywood Gaming at Dayton Raceway
Raceway Park (Ohio).description: Hollywood Gaming at Dayton Raceway, formerly Raceway Park in Toledo, Ohio, is a racino in Dayton, Ohio United States. Established in 1959 Raceway Park originally hosted car racing and thoroughbred racing. It is owned by Penn National Gaming. Wikipedia

Ankara 75th Anniversary Race Course.label: Ankara 75th Anniversary Race Course
Ankara 75th Anniversary Race Course.description: Ankara 75th Anniversary Race Course is a horse racing track located at Batıkent neighborhood in Yenimahalle district of Ankara, Turkey. It is founded in 1998, which was the 75th anniversary of Turkish Republic's foundation. Wikipedia

Guindy Race Course.label: Guindy Race Course
Guindy Race Course.description: The Guindy Race Course is a horse racing course set up in 1777 in Chennai, India. It is the oldest race course in India. It hosts events in the winter season. Wikipedia

Mahalaxmi Racecourse.label: Mahalaxmi Racecourse
Mahalaxmi Racecourse.description: The Mahalaxmi Racecourse is a horse racing track in Mahalaxmi neighbourhood, of Mumbai. The track is oval shaped with 2,400 metres straight chute, spread over approximately 225 acres of open land in the heart of Mumbai city. Wikipedia

Plainridge Racecourse.label: Plainridge Racecourse
Plainridge Racecourse.description: Plainridge Racecourse is a harness racing track in Plainville, Massachusetts. Wikipedia

Connaught Park Racetrack.label: Connaught Park Racetrack
Connaught Park Racetrack.description: Connaught Park, later known as Hippodrome d'Aylmer, was a thoroughbred, steeplechase and harness racing track, later having a casino and live betting parlor, located in the Aylmer, Quebec district of ... Wikipedia

Kensington Hippodrome.label: Kensington Hippodrome
Kensington Hippodrome.description: The Kensington Hippodrome was a racecourse built in Notting Hill, London, in 1837, by entrepreneur John Whyte. Wikipedia

Nakayama Racecourse.label: Nakayama Racecourse
Nakayama Racecourse.description: Nakayama Racecourse is located in Funabashi, Chiba, Japan. It is used for horse racing. It has a capacity of 165,676. It was built in 1990. It has 15,944 seats. Wikipedia

Bromford Bridge Racecourse.label: Bromford Bridge Racecourse
Bromford Bridge Racecourse.description: Bromford Bridge Racecourse was a racecourse in the Bromford area of Birmingham, England. Wikipedia

Kempton Park Racecourse.label: Kempton Park Racecourse
Kempton Park Racecourse.description: Kempton Park Racecourse is a horse racing track together with a licensed entertainment and conference venue in Sunbury-on-Thames, Surrey, 16 miles south-west of Charing Cross, London and on a border of Greater London. Wikipedia

Caymanas Park.label: Caymanas Park
Caymanas Park.description: Caymanas Park is Jamaica's only race track. It is mentioned in the Pioneer's song Longshot Kick The Bucket, which was covered by The Specials, in the line "What a weeping and a wailing down at Caymanas Park." Wikipedia

Champ de Mars Racecourse.label: Champ de Mars Racecourse
Champ de Mars Racecourse.description: The Champ de Mars Racecourse is a thoroughbred horse race track in Port Louis, Mauritius. The Racecourse was inaugurated on 25 June 1812, by The Mauritius Turf Club which was founded earlier in the same ... Wikipedia

Veliefendi Race Course.label: Veliefendi Race Course
Veliefendi Race Course.description: Veliefendi Race Course is a horse racing track located at Veliefendi neighborhood in Zeytinburnu district of Istanbul, Turkey. Wikipedia

Towcester Racecourse.label: Towcester Racecourse
Towcester Racecourse.description: Towcester Racecourse is a horse racing course at Towcester in Northamptonshire, England. Recently rebuilt, it hosts National Hunt Rules race meetings in the Winter months. It is situated on the Easton Neston estate. Wikipedia

Longchamp Racecourse.label: Longchamp Racecourse
Longchamp Racecourse.description: The 50,000 capacity Longchamp Racecourse is a 57 hectare horse-racing facility located on the Route des Tribunes in the Bois de Boulogne at Paris, France. Wikipedia

Polo Park Racetrack.label: Polo Park Racetrack
Polo Park Racetrack.description: The Polo Park Racetrack was a Canadian horse racing facility in Winnipeg, Manitoba. Considered one of the finest racetracks in Western Canada, it was built by Canadian Horse Racing Hall of Fame inductee R. James Speers. Wikipedia

Aintree Racecourse.label: Aintree Racecourse
Aintree Racecourse.description: Aintree Racecourse is a racecourse in Aintree, Merseyside, England close to the city of Liverpool. It was served by Aintree Racecourse railway station until the station closed in 1962. Wikipedia

Ascot Racecourse.label: Ascot Racecourse
Ascot Racecourse.description: Ascot Racecourse is a famous English racecourse, located in the small town of Ascot, Berkshire, used for thoroughbred horse racing. It is one of the leading racecourses in the United Kingdom, hosting 9 of the UK's 32 annual Group 1 races. Wikipedia

Maywood Park.label: Maywood Park
Maywood Park.description: Maywood Park is located in Melrose Park, Illinois, United States, 17 miles from Chicago. It is used for harness racing. It has a capacity of 33,297 people and was built in 1946. The track is a half-mile oval. Wikipedia

Salisbury Racecourse.label: Salisbury Racecourse
Salisbury Racecourse.description: Salisbury Racecourse is a flat racecourse in the United Kingdom featuring thoroughbred horse racing. It is located four miles from Salisbury, Wiltshire, England. Fifteen race meetings a year are held here between early May and mid-October. Wikipedia

Hakodate Racecourse.label: Hakodate Racecourse
Hakodate Racecourse.description: Hakodate Racecourse is a horse racing track in Hakodate, Japan, built in 1896. During the period between 2008 and 2009, Hakodate Racecourse was closed for renovation and refurbishment of the grandstand. Work was completed in June 2010. Wikipedia

Turfway Park.label: Turfway Park
Turfway Park.description: Turfway Park is an American horse racing track located just outside the city limits to the north of Florence, Kentucky, about 10 miles south of the Ohio River at Cincinnati. Wikipedia

Epsom Downs Racecourse.label: Epsom Downs Racecourse
Epsom Downs Racecourse.description: 120,000 capacity Epsom Downs is a Grade 1 racecourse near Epsom, Surrey, England. The "downs" referred to in the name are part of the North Downs. Wikipedia

Flemington Racecourse.label: Flemington Racecourse
Flemington Racecourse.description: Flemington Racecourse is a major horse racing venue located in Melbourne, Victoria, Australia. It is most notable for hosting the Melbourne Cup, which is Australia's richest horse race. Wikipedia

Hanshin Racecourse.label: Hanshin Racecourse
Hanshin Racecourse.description: Hanshin Racecourse is located in Takarazuka, Hyogo, Japan. It has a capacity of 139,000 and it is used for horse racing. The land was originally owned by Kawanishi Aircraft Company, which manufactured combat planes during World War II. Wikipedia

Kyoto Racecourse.label: Kyoto Racecourse
Kyoto Racecourse.description: Kyoto Racecourse is located in Fushimi-ku, Kyoto, Kyoto Prefecture, Japan. It is used for horse racing. It has a capacity of 120,000. It was built in 1999. Wikipedia

Randwick Racecourse.label: Randwick Racecourse
Randwick Racecourse.description: Royal Randwick Racecourse is a racecourse for horseracing in the Eastern Suburbs in Sydney, New South Wales. Randwick Racecourse is operated by the Australian Turf Club and known to many Sydney racegoers as headquarters. Wikipedia

Musselburgh Racecourse.label: Musselburgh Racecourse
Musselburgh Racecourse.description: Musselburgh Racecourse, known until the 1990s as Edinburgh Racecourse, is a horse racing venue located in the Millhill area of Musselburgh, East Lothian, Scotland, UK, close to the River Esk. Wikipedia

Emerald Downs.label: Emerald Downs
Emerald Downs.description: Emerald Downs is a thoroughbred racetrack in Auburn, Washington, located a half mile east of Highway 167. It is named after Seattle, the Emerald City. Wikipedia

Jamaica Race Course.label: Jamaica Race Course
Jamaica Race Course.description: Jamaica Race Course was an American thoroughbred horse racing facility operated by the Metropolitan Jockey Club in Jamaica, New York. The 1 mile track opened on April 27, 1903, a day which featured the inaugural running of the Excelsior Handicap. Wikipedia

Hamilton Park Racecourse.label: Hamilton Park Racecourse
Hamilton Park Racecourse.description: Hamilton Park Racecourse is a thoroughbred horse racing venue in Hamilton, Scotland to the south of Glasgow. It is a flat racing venue, with a season which runs from May to October. Wikipedia

Fontwell Park Racecourse.label: Fontwell Park Racecourse
Fontwell Park Racecourse.description: Fontwell Park Racecourse is a horse racing course located in the village of Fontwell in West Sussex, England, owned by Northern Racing. It features a figure-of-eight chase course and an oval hurdles course. Wikipedia

Curragh Racecourse.label: Curragh Racecourse
Curragh Racecourse.description: The Curragh Racecourse, usually abbreviated to The Curragh, is Ireland's most important Thoroughbred race track. It is situated on the Curragh plain near Newbridge, County Kildare, Ireland. Wikipedia

Cartmel Racecourse.label: Cartmel Racecourse
Cartmel Racecourse.description: Cartmel Racecourse is a small racecourse in the village of Cartmel, now in the Ceremonial County of Cumbria, historically in Lancashire. Wikipedia

Moonee Valley Racecourse.label: Moonee Valley Racecourse
Moonee Valley Racecourse.description: Moonee Valley Racecourse is a horse-racing track in Melbourne, Australia which hosts races for Thoroughbreds. Located six kilometres from the Melbourne CBD, it is the home of the Moonee Valley Racing Club. Wikipedia

Ohi Racecourse.label: Ohi Racecourse
Ohi Racecourse.description: Ohi Racecourse, also known as Tokyo City Keiba, is located in Shinagawa, Tokyo, Japan. Built in 1950 for horse racing, on weekends it also hosts one of the largest Tokyo-area flea markets. Wikipedia

York Racecourse.label: York Racecourse
York Racecourse.description: York Racecourse is a horse racing venue in York, North Yorkshire, England. It is the third biggest racecourse in Britain in terms of total prize money offered, and second behind Ascot in prize money offered per meeting. Wikipedia

Thorncliffe Park Raceway.label: Thorncliffe Park Raceway
Thorncliffe Park Raceway.description: Thorncliffe Park Raceway was a racetrack in Leaside, Ontario, Canada that operated from 1917 until 1952. It was located east of Millwood Road, south of Eglinton Avenue East and north of the CPR railroad tracks. Wikipedia

Hipódromo de Asunción.label: Hipódromo de Asunción
Hipódromo de Asunción.description: The Hipódromo de Asunción is a horse racing track located in the neighborhood of Hipódromo in Asunción, Paraguay. It is owned by the Jockey Club del Paraguay. It was inaugurated on September 18, 1954 and is the largest in the country. Wikipedia

Hipódromo De Los Andes.label: Hipódromo De Los Andes
Hipódromo De Los Andes.description:
The Hipódromo De Los Andes is a horse racing track located in the north of Bogota, Colombia. It haves a capacity for 20,000 people for concerts.
Nowadays, it is used only for events. Wikipedia

La Crosse Fairgrounds Speedway.label: La Crosse Fairgrounds Speedway
La Crosse Fairgrounds Speedway.description: The La Crosse Fairgrounds Speedway is a semi-banked asphalt oval racetrack in West Salem, Wisconsin. The outer track is 5/8 mile and the inner track is a 1/4 mile. The track was built on at the fairgrounds for La Crosse County. Wikipedia

Churchill Downs.label: Churchill Downs
Churchill Downs.description: Churchill Downs, located on Central Avenue in south Louisville, Kentucky, United States, is a Thoroughbred racetrack most famous for hosting the Kentucky Derby annually. Wikipedia

Playfair Race Course.label: Playfair Race Course
Playfair Race Course.description: Playfair Race Course, was the home of horse racing in Spokane, Washington, from 1901 to 2000. The track started out as a four furlong oval, later expanded to five furlongs in 1946. Wikipedia

Fair Grounds Race Course.label: Fair Grounds Race Course
Fair Grounds Race Course.description: Fair Grounds Race Course, often known as New Orleans Fair Grounds, is a thoroughbred racetrack and racino in New Orleans, Louisiana. It is operated by Churchill Downs Louisiana Horseracing Company, LLC. Wikipedia

Hollywood Park Racetrack.label: Hollywood Park Racetrack
Hollywood Park Racetrack.description: Hollywood Park, also known as Betfair Hollywood Park, was a thoroughbred race course and poker card room in Inglewood, California, about three miles from Los Angeles International Airport and adjacent to the Forum. Wikipedia

Blue Bonnets (raceway).label: Blue Bonnets
Blue Bonnets (raceway).description: Blue Bonnets Raceway was a horse racing track and casino in Montreal, Canada. After 137 years of operation, it closed in October 2009. Wikipedia

Tabcorp Park.label: Tabcorp Park
Tabcorp Park.description: Tabcorp Park is an Australian horse racing venue situated in Melton, Victoria, Australia; 40 kilometres north-west of the Melbourne CBD. It is used for harness racing and is operated by Harness Racing Victoria. Wikipedia

Ffos Las racecourse.label: Ffos Las racecourse
Ffos Las racecourse.description: The Ffos Las racecourse is a British horse racing, equestrian sports and conferencing venue situated in Ffos Las, Wales. The Ffos Las racecourse was built at the site of an open cast coal mine after mining operations ceased. Wikipedia

Mohawk Racetrack.label: Mohawk Racetrack
Mohawk Racetrack.description: Mohawk Racetrack is a harness racing track in Campbellville, Ontario. It is owned by the Woodbine Entertainment Group, formerly the Ontario Jockey Club, and is about 30 km west of the company's other racetrack, Woodbine Racetrack in Toronto. Wikipedia

Turffontein Racecourse.label: Turffontein Racecourse
Turffontein Racecourse.description: Turffontein Racecourse is a race track in South Africa for Thoroughbred horse racing founded in 1887 at Turffontein, Gauteng by the Johannesburg Turf Club. The facility has both an inner and outer grass track. Wikipedia
